questions.question:
A student investigated the effect of temperature on the rate of photosynthesis in pondweed. The number of oxygen bubbles produced in one minute was counted at different temperatures.

Temperature (°C): 10, 20, 30, 40, 50
Bubbles per minute: 12, 24, 36, 30, 8

a) Plot these results on a graph
b) Explain the shape of the graph
c) Suggest the optimum temperature for photosynthesis in this plant
answer: • Correct axes with labels and units (1)
• Points plotted accurately with line of best fit (1)
• Rate increases from 10-30°C as enzymes work faster (1)
• Rate decreases above 30°C as enzymes denature (1)
• 30°C - shown by highest number of bubbles (1)
questions.explanation: This question tests data handling skills and understanding of enzyme activity in photosynthesis.

questions.question: Describe and explain how the body responds when blood glucose levels become too high.
answer: • High blood glucose detected by pancreas (1)
• Insulin makes cells absorb more glucose (1)
• Excess glucose converted to glycogen in liver (1)
• Blood glucose levels return to normal (1)
questions.explanation: This question tests understanding of hormone action and negative feedback.

questions.question:
A student investigated osmosis using potato cylinders in different concentrations of sugar solution. Calculate the percentage change in mass for a potato cylinder that had:
Initial mass = 4.2g
Final mass = 4.8g
answer: 1. Recall formula: % change = (change in mass ÷ initial mass) × 100 (1)
questions.explanation: This question combines practical skills with mathematical calculations.
